Package it.polimi.ingsw.view.remote.cli

Class CLI

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.ingsw.view.remote.cli.CLI
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GraphicalInterface
    public class CLI
extends java.lang.Object
implements GraphicalInterface
    This class implements GraphicalInterface to allow a Client to be executed via command line interface.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private CommunicationHandler communicationHandler
      The CommunicationHandler responsible for the interaction with the remote Server.
      private java.util.concurrent.ScheduledExecutorService executor
      The ScheduledExecutorService responsible for all the periodical interrogations to the Server.
      private java.util.concurrent.ScheduledFuture<?> futureUpdate
      The ScheduledFuture used to control the executor tasks.
      private java.util.Scanner in
      The standard input method used by this CLI application.
      private boolean keepAlive
      A flag indicating whether it's necessary to wait for an incoming Deliverable.
      private java.util.List<java.lang.String> lobbies
      The List of Lobby available for the Client to join.
      private java.util.List<java.lang.String> opponents
      The List of Clients connected in the same Lobby of the current one.
      private int UPDATE_REQUEST_PERIOD
      The amount in seconds between successive executor executions.

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void display()
      Starts the CLI command line application.
      private java.lang.String in()
      Request an input value to the user and return the equivalent String to the caller.
      private void initLobby()
      Creates a new Lobby into the remote Server and logs the registered author in.
      private void loginToLobby​(java.lang.String lobbyName)
      Logs a registered Client into the given Lobby, specified by lobbyName.
      private void logoutFromLobby()
      Logs the current user out from the Lobby he previously joined.
      private void manageArrivals​(Deliverable deliverable)
      Processes the newly arrived Deliverable and acts consequently, either by notifying the player, printing the CLI interface, or opening a request routine via the Dispatcher.
      private void printAll​(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> lobbies)
      Prints the given Lobby list to the console.
      private void printCountDown​(int startingSeconds)
      Prints to the console the time left starting from the given startingSeconds down to zero.
      private void printOpponents()
      Prints the opponents list to the console after clearing the console output for better text formatting.
      private void printPauseMessage()
      Prints a console message to indicate that the timer has been paused.
      private void printPreGameInfo()
      Prints the last information before the Game starts.
      private void printWelcomeScreen()
      This is the first interface the user comes in contact with.
      private void register()
      Registers the current Client to the Server global list
      private java.lang.String requestChoice()
      Requests the user to provide a valid choice between the possible ones: 'n' representing the user decision to create a new Lobby or a number referenced in the lobbies list representing the user decision to join a specified Lobby.
      private java.lang.String requestLobbyName()
      Requests the user to provide a valid name for the Lobby needed by the caller.
      private java.lang.String requestLobbyPassword()
      Requests the user to provide a valid password for the Lobby the caller chooses to create.
      private java.lang.String requestUsername()
      Requests the user to provide a valid username.
      void setCommunicationHandler​(CommunicationHandler communicationHandler)
      Sets the communicationHandler interface for this console, allowing the Client to communicate with the remote Server.
      private void startLobbyUpdateAndPrint()
      Updates the local Lobby list: lobbies with the most recent one, provided by the remote Server and prints it into the standard output.
      private void stopCountDownPrint()
      Stops the count down and print procedure.
      private void stopLobbyUpdateAndPrint()
      Stops the Lobby list update and print process.
      private void unregister()
      Unregisters the Client from the Server global list.

    • Field Detail

      • lobbies

        private final java.util.List<java.lang.String> lobbies
        The List of Lobby available for the Client to join.

      • opponents

        private java.util.List<java.lang.String> opponents
        The List of Clients connected in the same Lobby of the current one. This collection can be empty if no Clienta joined the actual Lobby yet.

      • in

        private final java.util.Scanner in
        The standard input method used by this CLI application.

      • executor

        private java.util.concurrent.ScheduledExecutorService executor
        The ScheduledExecutorService responsible for all the periodical interrogations to the Server.

      • futureUpdate

        private java.util.concurrent.ScheduledFuture<?> futureUpdate
        The ScheduledFuture used to control the executor tasks.

      • UPDATE_REQUEST_PERIOD

        private final int UPDATE_REQUEST_PERIOD
        The amount in seconds between successive executor executions.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • communicationHandler

        private CommunicationHandler communicationHandler
        The CommunicationHandler responsible for the interaction with the remote Server.

      • keepAlive

        private boolean keepAlive
        A flag indicating whether it's necessary to wait for an incoming Deliverable. This happens if and only if this flag is set to true.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CLI

        public CLI()

    • Method Detail

      • setCommunicationHandler

        public void setCommunicationHandler​(CommunicationHandler communicationHandler)
        Sets the communicationHandler interface for this console, allowing the Client to communicate with the remote Server.
        Specified by:
        setCommunicationHandler in interface GraphicalInterface
        Parameters:
        communicationHandler - the new CommunicationHandler of this graphical interface.

      • display

        public void display()
        Starts the CLI command line application.
        Specified by:
        display in interface GraphicalInterface

      • manageArrivals

        private void manageArrivals​(Deliverable deliverable)
                     throws ConnectionException
        Processes the newly arrived Deliverable and acts consequently, either by notifying the player, printing the CLI interface, or opening a request routine via the Dispatcher.
        Parameters:
        deliverable - the newly arrived Deliverable.
        Throws:
        ConnectionException - when calling a CommunicationHandler.deliver(Deliverable) throws a ConnectionException.

      • in

        private java.lang.String in()
        Request an input value to the user and return the equivalent String to the caller.
        Returns:
        the String containing the user input.

      • register

        private void register()
        Registers the current Client to the Server global list

      • unregister

        private void unregister()
        Unregisters the Client from the Server global list.

      • startLobbyUpdateAndPrint

        private void startLobbyUpdateAndPrint()
        Updates the local Lobby list: lobbies with the most recent one, provided by the remote Server and prints it into the standard output.

      • stopLobbyUpdateAndPrint

        private void stopLobbyUpdateAndPrint()
        Stops the Lobby list update and print process.

      • initLobby

        private void initLobby()
        Creates a new Lobby into the remote Server and logs the registered author in.

      • loginToLobby

        private void loginToLobby​(java.lang.String lobbyName)
        Logs a registered Client into the given Lobby, specified by lobbyName.
        Parameters:
        lobbyName - the name of the Lobby the user wants to join into.

      • logoutFromLobby

        private void logoutFromLobby()
        Logs the current user out from the Lobby he previously joined.

      • requestUsername

        private java.lang.String requestUsername()
        Requests the user to provide a valid username. This method does not returns until a valid username has been inserted. A valid username must not be null or being made out of blank space characters only.
        Returns:
        the requested username.

      • requestLobbyName

        private java.lang.String requestLobbyName()
        Requests the user to provide a valid name for the Lobby needed by the caller. This method does not returns until a valid Lobby name has been inserted. A valid Lobby name must not be null or being made out of blank space characters only.
        Returns:
        the requested Lobby name.

      • requestLobbyPassword

        private java.lang.String requestLobbyPassword()
        Requests the user to provide a valid password for the Lobby the caller chooses to create. Since passwords have no restrictions and does not servers for security purposes, any given input to this method is considered as valid.
        Returns:
        the requested password.

      • requestChoice

        private java.lang.String requestChoice()
        Requests the user to provide a valid choice between the possible ones: 'n' representing the user decision to create a new Lobby or a number referenced in the lobbies list representing the user decision to join a specified Lobby.
        Returns:
        the user input choice.

      • printWelcomeScreen

        private void printWelcomeScreen()
        This is the first interface the user comes in contact with. It displays a user friendly console header.

      • printAll

        private void printAll​(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> lobbies)
        Prints the given Lobby list to the console. After that prints the possibility for the user to create a new Lobby.
        Parameters:
        lobbies - the Lobby list to be printed.

      • printPreGameInfo

        private void printPreGameInfo()
        Prints the last information before the Game starts. These includes the opponents list and the time left before the game starts.

      • printCountDown

        private void printCountDown​(int startingSeconds)
        Prints to the console the time left starting from the given startingSeconds down to zero. This procedure can be interrupted before the countdown reaches zero.
        Parameters:
        startingSeconds - the amount of seconds to start the countdown from.

      • stopCountDownPrint

        private void stopCountDownPrint()
        Stops the count down and print procedure.

      • printPauseMessage

        private void printPauseMessage()
        Prints a console message to indicate that the timer has been paused.

      • printOpponents

        private void printOpponents()
        Prints the opponents list to the console after clearing the console output for better text formatting.
